DOC.HEAD: Ford Boosts Minivan Incentive Program To Match Chrysler's
With AM-Auto Layoffs
DOC.TEXT: Ford Motor Co. announced Monday it is offering rebates of up to $1,000 on all 1989 and 1990 Aerostar minivans, matching incentives announced last week by Chrysler Corp. Effective Monday, rebates on 1989 Aerostars were increased from $500 to $1,000, and $1,000 rebates were offered on all 1990 models, Ford said. The incentives will be offered indefinitely, the automaker said. On Friday, Chrysler for the first time began offering rebates on its popular minivans, the Dodge Caravan, Plymouth Voyager and Chrysler Town and Country. The rebates are $1,000. Chrysler dominates the market for minivans, a class of vehicle it created. General Motors Corp. has not said whether it will offer similar incentives for its minivans. The rebates come at a time of a continuing sales slump in the auto industry that has lead to widespread temporary plant shutdowns.
